bsa_subject: Short title, application and commencement.
iea_subject: Short title, application and commencement.
summary: Indian Evidence Act, 1872 (IEA) provided that it extended to the whole of India, whereas Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam, 2023 (BSA) excludes this provision of territorial extent.

bsa_subject: Definitions.
iea_subject: Definitions.
summary: Interpretation clauses, which include words and expressions and are interpreted in paragraphs in the IEA, are now defined under Section 2(1): Definitions, where each word and expression is given individual alphabetical clauses. BSA excludes the interpretation of "India" previously given in Section 3 of the IEA.

bsa_subject: "Court".
iea_subject: "Court".

bsa_subject: "Conclusive proof".
iea_subject: "Conclusive proof".
summary: "Act" is replaced with "Adhiniyam". Wherever the word “Act” is used in IEA the word “Adhiniyam” is used in BSA, therefore, this fact will not be specifically mentioned in this table hereinafter. Word "means" is added.

bsa_subject: "disproved".
iea_subject: "disproved".
summary: Words "A fact is said to be disproved" are replaced by "in relation to a fact, means".

bsa_subject: "document".
iea_subject: "document".
summary: The words "or otherwise recorded" and "or any other means", "and includes electronic and digital records" are added.

bsa_subject: "evidence".
iea_subject: "evidence".
summary: "Words" "including statements given electronically" in (e ) (i) and "or digital" in (e ) (ii) are added.

bsa_subject: "fact".
iea_subject: "fact".
summary: Word "man" is replaced by "person" in illustrations and illustration (e)-"That a man has a certain reputation, is a fact" is now excluded in BSA.

bsa_subject: "facts in issue".
iea_subject: "facts in issue".

bsa_subject: "may presume".
iea_subject: "may presume".

bsa_subject: "not proved".
iea_subject: "not proved".

bsa_subject: "proved".
iea_subject: "proved".

bsa_subject: "relevant".
iea_subject: "relevant".

bsa_subject: "shall presume".
iea_subject: "shall presume".

bsa_subject: Words and expressions.
iea_subject: Words and expressions.
summary: Newly added. “Words and expressions used herein and not defined but defined in the Information Technology Act, 2000 (21 of 2000), the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023, and the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023, shall have the same meanings as assigned to them in the said Act and Sanhitas.”

bsa_subject: Evidence maybe given of facts in issue and relevant facts.
iea_subject: Evidence maybe given of facts in issue and relevant facts.

bsa_subject: Relevancy of facts forming part of same transaction.
iea_subject: Relevancy of facts forming part of same transaction.

bsa_subject: Facts which are occasion, cause or effect of facts in issue or relevant facts.
iea_subject: Facts which are occasion, cause or effect of facts in issue or relevant facts.
summary: Words "or relevant facts" added in heading.

bsa_subject: Motive, preparation and previous or subsequent conduct.
iea_subject: Motive, preparation and previous or subsequent conduct.
summary: In explanation. And in illustrations "vakils" is replaced by "advocates" "man" is replaced by "person" and "ravished" is replaced by " raped".

bsa_subject: Facts necessary to explain or introduce fact in issue or relevant facts.
iea_subject: Facts necessary to explain or introduce fact in issue or relevant facts.
summary: Words "fact in issue or" are added in the heading. "A" is replaced by "he".

bsa_subject: Things said or done by conspirator in reference to common design.
iea_subject: Things said or done by conspirator in reference to common design.
summary: No change except in illustrations, "Government of India" is replaced by "State", and city names are changed from Calcutta to Kolkata, Bombay to Mumbai, and Kabul to Singapore.

bsa_subject: When facts not otherwise relevant become relevant.
iea_subject: When facts not otherwise relevant become relevant.
summary: No Change except in illustrations cities names are changed from Calcutta to Chennai and Lahore to Laddakh.

bsa_subject: Facts tending to enable Court to determine amount are relevant in suits for damages.
iea_subject: Facts tending to enable Court to determine amount are relevant in suits for damages.
summary: No change except in the heading, where the words "In suits for damages" are placed at the end instead of the beginning.

bsa_subject: Facts relevant when right or custom is in question
iea_subject: Facts relevant when right or custom is in question

bsa_subject: Facts showing existence of state of mind, or of body or bodily feeling.
iea_subject: Facts showing existence of state of mind, or of body or bodily feeling.
summary: In illustrations, word "coin" is replaced by "currency" and "carriage" is replaced by "cars".

bsa_subject: Facts bearing on question whether act was accidental or intentional.
iea_subject: Facts bearing on question whether act was accidental or intentional.
summary: In illustrations, word "rupee" is replaced by "currency".

bsa_subject: Existence of course of business when relevant.
iea_subject: Existence of course of business when relevant.

bsa_subject: Admission defined.
iea_subject: Admission defined.

bsa_subject: Admission by party to proceeding or his agent.
iea_subject: Admission by party to proceeding or his agent.
summary: Headings of paragraphs are excluded and written as subsections and clauses.

bsa_subject: Admissions by persons whose position must be proved as against party to suit.
iea_subject: Admissions by persons whose position must be proved as against party to suit.

bsa_subject: Admissions by persons expressly referred to by party to suit.
iea_subject: Admissions by persons expressly referred to by party to suit.

bsa_subject: Proof of admissions against persons making them, and by or on their behalf.
iea_subject: Proof of admissions against persons making them, and by or on their behalf.

bsa_subject: When oral admissions as to contents of documents are relevant.
iea_subject: When oral admissions as to contents of documents are relevant.

bsa_subject: Admissions in civil cases when relevant.
iea_subject: Admissions in civil cases when relevant.
summary: Words "barrister, pleader, attorney or vakil" are replaced by "advocate".

bsa_subject: Confession caused by inducement, threat, coercion or promise, when irrelevant in criminal proceeding.
iea_subject: Confession caused by inducement, threat, coercion or promise, when irrelevant in criminal proceeding.
summary: The word "coercion" is added. Section 28 IEA and Section 29 IEA are given as provisions to Section 22 of the BSA. Heading is dropped as sections are included as provisions.

bsa_subject: Confession made after removal of impression caused by inducement, threat or promise, relevant.
iea_subject: Confession made after removal of impression caused by inducement, threat or promise, relevant.
summary: Heading is dropped as section is included as proviso.

bsa_subject: Confession otherwise relevant not to become irrelevant because of promise of secrecy, etc.
iea_subject: Confession otherwise relevant not to become irrelevant because of promise of secrecy, etc.
summary: Heading is dropped as section is included as provision.

bsa_subject: Confession to police-officer not to be proved.
iea_subject: Confession to police-officer not to be proved.
summary: Words "not to be proved" are excluded from heading.

bsa_subject: Confession by accused while in custody of police not to be proved against him.
iea_subject: Confession by accused while in custody of police not to be proved against him.
summary: Heading is dropped as the section is included as a subsection. Word "whilst" is replaced by "while" and words "such person" are replaced by "him".

bsa_subject: How much of information received from accused may be proved.
iea_subject: How much of information received from accused may be proved.
summary: Heading is dropped as the section is included as proviso.

bsa_subject: Consideration of proved confession affecting person making it and others jointly under trial for same offence.
iea_subject: Consideration of proved confession affecting person making it and others jointly under trial for same offence.
summary: A new explanation II is added, mentioning that "A trial of more persons than one held in the absence of the accused who has absconded or who fails to comply with a proclamation issued under Section 84 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023, shall be deemed to be a joint trial for the purpose of this section."

bsa_subject: Admissions not conclusive proof, but may estop.
iea_subject: Admissions not conclusive proof, but may estop.

bsa_subject: Cases in which statement of relevant fact by person who is dead or cannot be found, etc., is relevant.
iea_subject: Cases in which statement of relevant fact by person who is dead or cannot be found, etc., is relevant.
summary: Word "namely" is added and headings of subsections are dropped. In illustration word "ravished" is replaced by "raped" and word "banya" is replaced by "business".

bsa_subject: Relevancy of certain evidence for proving, in subsequent proceeding, truth of facts therein stated.
iea_subject: Relevancy of certain evidence for proving, in subsequent proceeding, truth of facts therein stated.
summary: No change except that word "that" is replaced by "and" in proviso.

bsa_subject: Entries in books of account when relevant.
iea_subject: Entries in books of account when relevant.
summary: No change except the words "include those maintained in an electronic form" are excluded from the heading.

bsa_subject: Relevancy of entry in public record or an electronic record made in performance of duty.
iea_subject: Relevancy of entry in public record or an electronic record made in performance of duty.

bsa_subject: Relevancy of statements in maps, charts and plans.
iea_subject: Relevancy of statements in maps, charts and plans.

bsa_subject: Relevancy of statement as to fact of public nature contained in certain Acts or notifications.
iea_subject: Relevancy of statement as to fact of public nature contained in certain Acts or notifications.
summary: Words "any Act of Parliament 4 (of the United Kingdom) or or in any 5 Central Act, Provincial Act or 6 a State Act or in a Government notification or notification by the Crown Representative appearing in the Official Gazette or in any printed paper purporting to be the London Gazette or the Government Gazette of any Dominion, colony, or possession of his Majesty is a relevant fact." are replaced by  "any Central Act or State Act or in a Central Government or State Government notification appearing in the respective Official Gazette or in any printed paper or in electronic or digital form purporting to be such Gazette, is a relevant fact".

bsa_subject: Relevancy of statements as to any law contained in law books including electronic or digital form.
iea_subject: Relevancy of statements as to any law contained in law books including electronic or digital form.
summary: Words "including in electronic or digital form" are added in heading as well as in the main text of the section.

bsa_subject: nan
iea_subject: nan

bsa_subject: Previous judgments relevant to bar a second suit or trial.
iea_subject: Previous judgments relevant to bar a second suit or trial.

bsa_subject: Relevancy of certain judgments in probate, etc., jurisdiction.
iea_subject: Relevancy of certain judgments in probate, etc., jurisdiction.
summary: The word "Tribunal" is added. Paragraph "Such judgment, order or decree is conclusive proof that" is given as subsection (2) and conditions under this are enumerated as (i), (ii), (iii), and (iv). The word "that" is excluded.

bsa_subject: Relevancy      and      effect      of judgments,   orders   or   decrees, other  than  those  mentioned  in section35[41 IEA].
iea_subject: Relevancy      and      effect      of judgments,   orders   or   decrees, other  than  those  mentioned  in section35[41 IEA].

bsa_subject: Judgments, etc., other than those mentioned in sections 34, 35 and 36 [40to 42 IEA] when relevant.
iea_subject: Judgments, etc., other than those mentioned in sections 34, 35 and 36 [40to 42 IEA] when relevant.

bsa_subject: Fraud  or  collusion  in  obtaining judgment,   or   incompetency   of Court, may be proved.
iea_subject: Fraud  or  collusion  in  obtaining judgment,   or   incompetency   of Court, may be proved.

bsa_subject: Opinions of experts.
iea_subject: Opinions of experts.
summary: Words "or any other field" are added. Thus, scope is expanded greatly.

bsa_subject: Opinion of Examiner of Electronic Evidence.
iea_subject: Opinion of Examiner of Electronic Evidence.
summary: Heading is dropped as section is added as a subsection.

bsa_subject: Facts bearing upon opinions of experts.
iea_subject: Facts bearing upon opinions of experts.

bsa_subject: Opinion   as   to   handwriting   and signature, when relevant.
iea_subject: Opinion   as   to   handwriting   and signature, when relevant.
summary: Words "and signature" are added in heading.

bsa_subject: Opinion as to electronic signature, when relevant.
iea_subject: Opinion as to electronic signature, when relevant.
summary: Heading is dropped as section is added as a subsection.

bsa_subject: Opinion as to existence of general custom or right, when relevant.
iea_subject: Opinion as to existence of general custom or right, when relevant.

bsa_subject: Opinion as to usages, tenets, etc., when relevant.
iea_subject: Opinion as to usages, tenets, etc., when relevant.
summary: Paragraphs are numbered as clauses (i), (ii) and (iii).

bsa_subject: Opinion on relationship, when relevant.
iea_subject: Opinion on relationship, when relevant.

bsa_subject: Grounds        of         opinion, when relevant.
iea_subject: Grounds        of         opinion, when relevant.

bsa_subject: In civil cases character to prove conduct imputed, irrelevant.
iea_subject: In civil cases character to prove conduct imputed, irrelevant.

bsa_subject: In  criminal  cases  previous  good character relevant.
iea_subject: In  criminal  cases  previous  good character relevant.

bsa_subject: Evidence of character or previous sexual experience not relevant in certain cases.
iea_subject: Evidence of character or previous sexual experience not relevant in certain cases.

bsa_subject: Previous bad character not relevant, except in reply
iea_subject: Previous bad character not relevant, except in reply

bsa_subject: Character as affecting damages.
iea_subject: Character as affecting damages.

bsa_subject: Fact judicially noticeable need not be proved.
iea_subject: Fact judicially noticeable need not be proved.

bsa_subject: Facts  of  which  Court  shall  take judicial notice.
iea_subject: Facts  of  which  Court  shall  take judicial notice.
summary: Paragraphs are numbered as subsections (1) and (2), and facts enumeration as (1) to (13) is replaced by alphabetic clauses (a) to (l), excluding (2), (3), and (5). These exclusions remove colonial vestiges from the text. A new clause (b) is newly added, mentioning "international treaty, agreement or convention with country or countries by India, or decisions made by India at the international associations or other bodies;".

bsa_subject: Facts admitted need not be proved.
iea_subject: Facts admitted need not be proved.

bsa_subject: Proof of facts by oral evidence.
iea_subject: Proof of facts by oral evidence.

bsa_subject: Oral evidence to be direct.
iea_subject: Oral evidence to be direct.
summary: In heading word "must" is replaced by "to" and paragraph are numbered as clauses (i), (ii), (iii)and (iv). Word "also" is replaced by "further".

bsa_subject: Proof of contents of documents.
iea_subject: Proof of contents of documents.

bsa_subject: Primary evidence.
iea_subject: Primary evidence.

bsa_subject: Secondary evidence.
iea_subject: Secondary evidence.
summary: Words "means and" are excluded and three new clauses (vi), (vii), and (viii) are added.

bsa_subject: Proof of documents by primary evidence.
iea_subject: Proof of documents by primary evidence.

bsa_subject: Cases     in     which     secondary evidence   relating   to   documents may be given.
iea_subject: Cases     in     which     secondary evidence   relating   to   documents may be given.
summary: The word "namely" is added and paragraph of clause (a) are numbered as (i), (ii), and (iii).

bsa_subject: Electronic or digital record.
iea_subject: Electronic or digital record.
summary: “Nothing in this Adhiniyam shall apply to deny the admissibility of an electronic or digital record in the evidence on the ground that it is an electronic or digital record and such record shall, subject to section 63, have the same legal effect, validity and enforceability as other document.”

bsa_subject: Special  provisions  as  to  evidence relating to electronic record.
iea_subject: Special  provisions  as  to  evidence relating to electronic record.

bsa_subject: missibility      of      electronic ords.
iea_subject: missibility      of      electronic ords.
summary: Words "or semiconductor memory" "or any communication device or otherwise stored, recorded, or copied in any electronic form" is added in subsection (1). Words "communication device", "create" are added in subsection (2). In subsection (3), the word "computer" is replaced by "by means of one or more computers or communication devices," and new clauses (a) to (e) are added newly. In subsection (4), the words "that is to say" are replaced by "shall be submitted along with the electronic record at each instance where it is being submitted for admission, namely:". The words "or a communication device referred to in clauses (a) to (e) of sub-section (3)" are added to clause (b) of subsection (4), and in clause (c), the words "person occupying a responsible official position in relation to the operation of the relevant device or the management of the relevant activities" are replaced by "person in charge of the computer or communication device or the management of the relevant activities". The words "and an expert" and "in the certificate specified in the schedule"  are added. Clause (b) of subsection (5) of IEA is excluded and now (c) corresponds to (b), where words "communication device" and "or by other electronic means as referred to in clauses (a) to (e) of sub            - section (3)". are added.

bsa_subject: Rules as to notice to produce.
iea_subject: Rules as to notice to produce.
summary: "attorney or pleader" is replaced by "advocate or representative".

bsa_subject: Proof of         signature         and handwriting of person alleged to have signed or written document produced.
iea_subject: Proof of         signature         and handwriting of person alleged to have signed or written document produced.

bsa_subject: Proof as to electronic signature.
iea_subject: Proof as to electronic signature.

bsa_subject: Proof  of  execution  of  document required by law to be attested.
iea_subject: Proof  of  execution  of  document required by law to be attested.

bsa_subject: Proof where no attesting witness found.
iea_subject: Proof where no attesting witness found.
summary: Words "or if the document purports to have been executed in the United Kingdom" are excluded.

bsa_subject: Admission of execution by party to attested document.
iea_subject: Admission of execution by party to attested document.

bsa_subject: Proof when attesting witness denies execution.
iea_subject: Proof when attesting witness denies execution.

bsa_subject: Proof of document not required by law to be attested.
iea_subject: Proof of document not required by law to be attested.

bsa_subject: Comparison of signature, writing or seal with others admitted or proved.
iea_subject: Comparison of signature, writing or seal with others admitted or proved.
summary: Paragraph are numbered as Subsections (1), (2) and (3).

bsa_subject: Proof as to verification of digital signature.
iea_subject: Proof as to verification of digital signature.

bsa_subject: Public and private documents.
iea_subject: Public and private documents.
summary: The words " and private" are added in the heading.  The words "any part of" and "or of the commonwealth" are excluded.

bsa_subject: Public and private documents.
iea_subject: Public and private documents.
summary: The words "or Union territory" and "except the documents referred to in sub-section (1)" are added.

bsa_subject: Certified        copies  of         public documents.
iea_subject: Certified        copies  of         public documents.

bsa_subject: of       of       documents       by duction of certified copies.
iea_subject: of       of       documents       by duction of certified copies.

bsa_subject: Proof of other official documents.
iea_subject: Proof of other official documents.
summary: The conditions' enumeration as (1) to (6) is changed to (a) to (f). The expressions "or of the Crown Representative", "or, as the case may be, of the Crown Representative;",  "Her Majesty] or by the Privy Council, or by any department of Her Majesty’s Government" and "London Gazette, or purporting to be printed by the Queen’s Printer;" are excluded. The words "Ministries and" "or Union territory Administration", "Parliament or a State" and "President of India or the Governor of a State or the Administrator or Lieutenant Governor of a Union territory, by copies or extracts contained in the Official Gazette;" are added.

bsa_subject: Presumption  as  to  genuineness  of certified copies.
iea_subject: Presumption  as  to  genuineness  of certified copies.
summary: The words "or by any officer [in the State of Jammu and Kashmir] who is duly authorised thereto by the Central Government:" are excluded and paragraph are numbered as subsections.

bsa_subject: Presumption    as    to    documents produced  as  record  of  evidence, etc.
iea_subject: Presumption    as    to    documents produced  as  record  of  evidence, etc.
summary: The word "that" is excluded and paragraph are numbered as clauses (i), (ii) and (iii).

bsa_subject: Presumption       as       to       Gazettes, newspapers,       [private       Acts       of parliament] and other documents.
iea_subject: Presumption       as       to       Gazettes, newspapers,       [private       Acts       of parliament] and other documents.
summary: " the London Gazette or any Official Gazette, or the Government Gazette of any colony, dependency or possession of the British Crown, or to be a newspaper or journal or to be a copy of a private Act of Parliament of the United Kingdom printed by the Queen’s Printer" are replaced by "the Official Gazette". A new explanation is added regarding proper custody.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to Gazettes in electronic or digital record.
iea_subject: Presumption as to Gazettes in electronic or digital record.
summary: A new explanation is added regarding proper custody of electronic document. Its phraseology is similar to the new explanation added in the preceding section.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to maps or plans made by authority of Government.
iea_subject: Presumption as to maps or plans made by authority of Government.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to collections of laws and reports of decisions.
iea_subject: Presumption as to collections of laws and reports of decisions.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to powers-ofattorney.
iea_subject: Presumption as to powers-ofattorney.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to electronic agreements.
iea_subject: Presumption as to electronic agreements.

bsa_subject: sumption as to electronic ords and electronic signatures.
iea_subject: sumption as to electronic ords and electronic signatures.

bsa_subject: Presumption  as  to  Electronic  Signature Certificates.
iea_subject: Presumption  as  to  Electronic  Signature Certificates.

bsa_subject: Presumption  as  to  certified  copies  of foreign judicial records.
iea_subject: Presumption  as  to  certified  copies  of foreign judicial records.
summary: "any country not forming part of India or of Her Majesty’s Dominions" is replaced by "beyond India".

bsa_subject: Presumption   as   to   books,   maps   and charts.
iea_subject: Presumption   as   to   books,   maps   and charts.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to electronic messages.
iea_subject: Presumption as to electronic messages.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to due execution, etc., of documents not produced.
iea_subject: Presumption as to due execution, etc., of documents not produced.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to documents thirty years old.
iea_subject: Presumption as to documents thirty years old.
summary: A new explanation same as of section 80 is added. In illustration "is" is replaced by "shall be".

bsa_subject: Presumption as to electronic records five years old.
iea_subject: Presumption as to electronic records five years old.
summary: A new explanation same as of section 81 is added.

bsa_subject: Evidence  of  terms  of  contracts,  grants and   other   dispositions   of   property reduced to form of document.
iea_subject: Evidence  of  terms  of  contracts,  grants and   other   dispositions   of   property reduced to form of document.

bsa_subject: Exclusion of evidence of oral agreement.
iea_subject: Exclusion of evidence of oral agreement.
summary: The words "to the last section" are replaced by section number "94" Instead of writing  "Proviso 1"  "Proviso 2" etc. "Provided that", Provided further that" etc. are used while writing proviso in this section. In illustrations, " Calcutta" and "London" are replaced by "Kolkata" and "Visakhapatnam", "2023" is used in place of "1978" and "thirty thousand" and "ten thousand" in place of "500" and "200" to make it contemporary.

bsa_subject: Exclusion   of   evidence   to   explain   or amend ambiguous document.
iea_subject: Exclusion   of   evidence   to   explain   or amend ambiguous document.
summary: In illustrations, "Rs. 1000" and "Rs. 1500" are replaced by "one lakh rupees" "one lakh fifty thousand rupees" respectively.

bsa_subject: Exclusion of evidence against application of document to existing facts.
iea_subject: Exclusion of evidence against application of document to existing facts.

bsa_subject: Evidence as to document unmeaning in reference to existing facts.
iea_subject: Evidence as to document unmeaning in reference to existing facts.
summary: In illustrations, " Calcutta" is replaced by "Kolkata".

bsa_subject: Evidence as to application of language which can apply to one only of several persons.
iea_subject: Evidence as to application of language which can apply to one only of several persons.
summary: In illustrations, "Haidarabad", "Haidarabad in Dekkan"  and "Haidarabad in sindh" are replaced by "Ramgarh" , "Ramgarh in Rajasthan" and "Ramgarh in Uttarakhand" respectively.

bsa_subject: Evidence as to application of language to one of two sets of facts, to neither of which the whole correctly applies.
iea_subject: Evidence as to application of language to one of two sets of facts, to neither of which the whole correctly applies.

bsa_subject: dence as to meaning of gible characters, etc.
iea_subject: dence as to meaning of gible characters, etc.

iea_subject: Who  may  give  evidence  of  agreement varying terms of document.

bsa_subject: Saving     of     provisions     of     Indian Succession Act relating to wills.
iea_subject: Saving     of     provisions     of     Indian Succession Act relating to wills.
summary: The words "the Indian Succession Act, (10 of 1865)" are replaced by  "the Indian Succession Act, 1925 (39 of 1925)".

bsa_subject: Burden of proof.
iea_subject: Burden of proof.

bsa_subject: On whom burden of proof lies.
iea_subject: On whom burden of proof lies.

bsa_subject: Burden of proof as to particular fact.
iea_subject: Burden of proof as to particular fact.

bsa_subject: Burden of proving fact to be proved to make evidence admissible.
iea_subject: Burden of proving fact to be proved to make evidence admissible.

bsa_subject: Burden of proving that case of accused comes  within exceptions.
iea_subject: Burden of proving that case of accused comes  within exceptions.

iea_subject: Burden of proving fact especially within knowledge.

iea_subject: Burden   of   proving   death   of   person known to have been alive within thirty years.

iea_subject: Burden of proving that person is alive who  has  not  been  heard  of  for  seven years.

iea_subject: Burden of proof as to relationship in the cases  of  partners,  landlord  and  tenant, principal and agent.

iea_subject: Burden of proof as to ownership.

summary: IPC sections are replaced by corresponding BNS sections.

iea_subject: Birth during marriage, conclusive proof of legitimacy.
summary: "son" is replaced by "child" thus made gender neutral.

iea_subject: Presumption as to abetment of suicide by a married woman.
summary: The words "section 498A of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860)"  are replaced by "section 86 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023" in the explanation.

bsa_subject: Presumption as to dowry death.
iea_subject: Presumption as to dowry death.
summary: The words "section 304B of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860)"  are replaced by "section 80 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023" in explanation.

bsa_subject: Court may presume existence of certain facts.
iea_subject: Court may presume existence of certain facts.
summary: Paragraph are numbered as subsections (1) and (2), and illustrations to subsection (2) are numbered from (i) to (x).

iea_subject: Judge's power to put questions or order production.
